{{ infobox football match | event = 1999 Asian Super Cup | team1 = [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] | team2 = [[Ittihad FC (Jeddah)|Ittihad]] | team1association = | team2association = | team1score = 2 | team2score = 2 | firstleg = First leg | team1score1 = 1 | team2score1 = 0 | date1 = October 22, 1999 | stadium1 = [[Yamaha Stadium|JÃºbilo Iwata Stadium]] | city1 = [[Iwata, Shizuoka]], [[Japan]] | attendance1 = | referee1 = | secondleg = Second leg | team1score2 = 1 | team2score2 = 2 | date2 = December 5, 1999 | stadium2 = [[Prince Abdullah al-Faisal Stadium]] | city2 = [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]] | attendance2 = | referee2 = | previous = [[1998 Asian Super Cup|1998]] | next = [[2000 Asian Super Cup|2000]] }} The '''1999 Asian Super Cup''' was the 5th [[Asian Super Cup]], a [[association football|football]] match played between the winners of the previous season's [[1998â99 Asian Club Championship#Champions|Asian Club Championship]] and [[1998â99 Asian Cup Winners' Cup#Champions|Asian Cup Winners Cup]] competitions. The 1999 competition was contested by [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] of [[Japan]], who won the [[1998â99 Asian Club Championship]], and [[Ittihad FC (Jeddah)|Al Ittihad]] of [[Saudi Arabia]], the winners of the [[1998â99 Asian Cup Winners' Cup]]. == Route to the Super Cup == === JÃºbilo Iwata === {{details|1998â99 Asian Club Championship}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !JÃºbilo Iwata goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|HKG}} [[Double Flower FA|Instant Dict]] || First round || 7â0 || ? |- |{{flagicon|MYA|1974}} [[Finance and Revenue FC|Finance and Revenue]] || Second round|| 4â0 2 || ? |- |{{flagicon|KOR}} [[Pohang Steelers]] || Quarterfinals || 1â1 || [[Masashi Nakayama]] {{goal|28}} |- |{{flagicon|CHN}} [[Dalian Shide|Dalian Wanda]] || Quarterfinals || 0â2 || |- |{{flagicon|KOR}} [[Busan I'Park|Busan Daewoo Royals]] || Quarterfinals || 2â0 || [[Daisuke Oku]] {{goal|63}}, [[Toshiya Fujita]] {{goal|90}} |- |{{flagicon|UAE}} [[Al Ain Club|Al-Ain]] || Semifinals || 2â2 ([[Extra time|aet]], 2 [[Penalty shootout (association football)|PK]] 4) || [[Makoto Tanaka]] {{goal|15}}, [[Toshiya Fujita]] {{goal|37}} |- |{{flagicon|IRN}} [[Esteghlal FC|Esteghlal]] || finals || 2â1 || [[Hideto Suzuki]] {{goal|36}}, [[Masashi Nakayama]] {{goal|45}} |} 1JÃºbilo Iwata goals always recorded first.
2 The match was played over one leg by mutual agreement. === Al Ittihad === {{details|1998â99 Asian Cup Winners' Cup}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !Opponents !Round !Score1 !Al Ittihad goalscorers |- |{{flagicon|QAT}} [[Al-Ahly Doha|Al Ahly]] || Second round|| 7â1 || ? |- |{{flagicon|UZB}} [[FC Pakhtakor Tashkent|Pakhtakor]] || Quarterfinals || 4â0 || ? |- |{{flagicon|IRQ|1991}} [[Talaba SC|Al Talaba]] || Semifinals || 3â1 || [[Mohammed Al Sahafi]] {{goal|20}}, [[Dalian Atkinson]] {{goal|25}}, [[Ahmed Bahja]] {{goal|90}} |- |{{flagicon|KOR}} [[Chunnam Dragons]] || Final || 3â2 ([[Extra time|aet]]) || [[Ahmed Bahja]] {{goal|10}} ([[Penalty shootout (association football)|p]]) {{goal|105}} ([[Penalty shootout (association football)|p]]), [[Mohammed Hawsawi]] {{goal|84}} |} 1 Al Ittihad goals always recorded first. == Game summary == {{TwoLeg start}} {{TwoLegResult| '''[[JÃºbilo Iwata]]''' | JPN | 2-2 ([[Away goals rule|a]]) | [[Ittihad FC (Jeddah)|Al Ittihad]] | SAU | 1-0 | 1-2 | winner=2}} |} === First Game === {{footballbox |date = October 22, 1999 |team1 = [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] {{flagicon|JPN}} |score = 1â0 |team2 = {{flagicon|SAU}} [[Ittihad FC (Jeddah)|Al Ittihad]] |goals1 = [[Masashi Nakayama]] {{goal|?}} |goals2 = |stadium = [[Yamaha Stadium|JÃºbilo Iwata Stadium]], [[Iwata, Shizuoka]], [[Japan]] }} === Second Game === {{footballbox |date = October 22, 1999 |team1 = [[Ittihad FC (Jeddah)|Al Ittihad]] {{flagicon|SAU}} |score = 2â1 |team2 = {{flagicon|JPN}} [[JÃºbilo Iwata]] |goals1 = [[Hassan Al Yani]] {{goal|78}}
